Returns: A linear interpolation between the start and end values, given the fraction parameter.
Parameters: float: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
evaluate(float,android.graphics.Rect,and.Description: This function returns the result of linearly interpolating the start and end Rect values, with fraction representing the proportion between the start and end values. The calculation is a simple parametric calculation on each of the separate components in the Rect objects (left, top, right, and bottom). If @B_android#animation#RectEvaluator#RectEvaluator_E@ was used to construct this RectEvaluator, the object returned will be the reuseRect passed into the constructor.
evaluate(float,android.graphics.Rect,and.FullName: public Rect evaluate (float fraction, Rect startValue, Rect endValue)

Parameters: Rect: A Rect to be modified and returned by evaluate.
RectEvaluator(android.graphics.Rect).Description: Constructs a RectEvaluator that modifies and returns reuseRect in @B_android#animation#RectEvaluator#evaluate_E@ calls. The value returned from @B_android#animation#RectEvaluator#evaluate_E@ should not be cached because it will change over time as the object is reused on each call.

RectEvaluator().Description: Construct a RectEvaluator that returns a new Rect on every evaluate call. To avoid creating an object for each evaluate call, @B_android#animation#RectEvaluator#RectEvaluator_E@ should be used whenever possible.

ClassDesc: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between Rect values.
